data.name: Palindromes
data.description:
A palindrome is a word, phrase, number, or other sequence of characters which reads the same backward or forward. Allowances may be made for adjustments to capital letters, punctuation, and word dividers. - Wikipedia

We are used to palindromes involving whole words and phrases such as:

- "A man, a plan, a canal, Panama!"
- "put it up" or
- "Was it a car or a cat I saw?"

However, in this kata, you are asked to complete the function `palindrome`. This function takes `1` argument, the string to be checked.

The string to be passed to the function will not be always comprised of full words, it can be any sequence of characters. 

This said, your goal is to determine if ANY rearrangement of the characters in the string can form a palindrome string and print it.

Return `false` if there's no such arrangement.

Examples:

- `"dbcbdccbaabadceda"` is a palindrome since it can be rearranged to `"aabbccddeddccbbaa"` or `"bbaaddcceccddaabb"`
